intro: Meiogyne leptoneura, commonly known as the slender-veined meiogyne, is a rare and distinctive member of the Arecaceae family, native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnate leaves with long, narrow leaflets. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear yellowish-green flowers, followed by edible fruits that are small and fleshy. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range. Its botanical features make it an important subject for conservation and botanical research.
